subject: Photography
title: Leaving Space for the Subject to Move
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Leaving Space for the Subject to Move.

hook.text: A runner pressed against the frame edge feels trapped. Give them space ahead and they feel free.

buildup.text: Active space â€” also called lead room â€” is empty space in front of a moving subject's direction of travel.

discovery.text: The same principle applies to gaze. A person looking left should have space to the left. It feels natural.

twist.text: Breaking this rule â€” placing the subject at the edge they face â€” creates claustrophobia and unease. Deliberately.

climax.text: Space isn't just compositional. It's emotional. Where you place the breathing room shapes how the viewer feels.

punchline.text: Let your subject breathe. Give them room to move.

quiz.question: What is 'lead room' in composition?
options: Empty space in front of a moving subject's direction
The area above the subject's head
